description: This is too bugy for me to be useable and it can't find the source file automatically. I better use "ddd"

Can cause the app to unrecoverably lock up just by clicking "Run or Restart".

Uses around 20% CPU continuously after launching. While running a process, even if that process is stopped, Nemiver continuously uses 100% CPU, heating up the laptop unnecessarily.

When inspecting structs, the list view control doesn't fill the whole window, and is only about 2 lines of height, which is totally unusable.

Looking at the bug tracker, recent comments suggest this app is no longer being developed. It should be removed from Fedora, because it's simply unusable in its current state.
Does not work, not able to run any program

Loaded Executable (/bin/bzcat) to test with, clicked "open" gone back to the (load) menu, the only option is to click "run executable", did that whilst having my display set to "Console", no output, also the main menu showing the "stop" button but does nothing. I tried all other menu options, nothing worked. 
What's the point calling it a "debugger" when you must click "run" to be back at the debugging interface? also why the "stop" not switching off and why everything else is grayed out? 
I tried /bin/bzcat and it worked in console, but with this debugger nothing display on the console output nor I can get the debugger to do anything at all.

it was a good debugger unfortunetly it is no longer maintained
it often crash
summary: it was a good debugger unfortunetly it is no longer maintained
